revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-02-14 00:29:09.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': 'L3 agent fetches the external network id once

Rather than fetching the id of the external network each time that
_process_routers is called, get it once and remember it.  If the agent
is ever requested to connect to a different ext-net then it will fetch
the current ext-net to double check for the unlikely event that the
ext-net has changed.  If it has then it will remember the new ext-net.

This is only applicable in the case where there is only one ext-net
that has not been configured explicitly in the config file.  That was
the only case that would cause an RPC message in the first place.

Change-Id: I40bbbf6233131ea5d40122ef9495fd3cb7dc823a
Closes-Bug: #1269567
'}]
commit_message:
L3 agent fetches the external network id once

Rather than fetching the id of the external network each time that
_process_routers is called, get it once and remember it.  If the agent
is ever requested to connect to a different ext-net then it will fetch
the current ext-net to double check for the unlikely event that the
ext-net has changed.  If it has then it will remember the new ext-net.

This is only applicable in the case where there is only one ext-net
that has not been configured explicitly in the config file.  That was
the only case that would cause an RPC message in the first place.

Change-Id: I40bbbf6233131ea5d40122ef9495fd3cb7dc823a
Closes-Bug: #1269567

commit_message:
Host aggregates panel.

On this panel, aggregates could be added, deleted and edited.
This patch takes the aggregates panel out of System Info and
puts it back in the main admin panel list, as now, aggregates
are not static information. The host can be associated to a
host aggregate on this panel as well.

Change-Id: I4ef2d87c33981db36d4ebd3de2f4841cdfa9dbfd
Closes-Bug: #1261932
Implements: blueprint manage-host-aggregates
Co-Authored-By: Santiago Baldassin <santiago.b.baldassin@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alejandro Paredes <alejandro.e.paredes@intel.com>

commit_message:
NSX: make sync backend run more often

This patch bumps the state_sync_interval from 120 seconds to 10 seconds
so that resource's operation status are synced to the db quicker. This cuts
the amount of time that tempest takes to run by half.

Closes-bug: 1285338
Co-Authored-By: Salvatore Orlando <salv.orlando@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I494a6f95c2321befc3c0bfedc719e18a1826d9d5

subject: Add tools/create_heat_domain helper script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-05 00:12:55.000000000', 'files': ['tools/create_heat_domain'], 'message': "Add tools/create_heat_domain helper script

For users who don't yet have python-openstackclient, or who require
a more automated way of creating the heat domain and domain-admin
user, provide a simple wrapper for the keystoneclient python API
which will create the domain and user, then print a helpful cut/paste
message to allow heat.conf to be easily updated.

It requires a cloud-admin users credentials to be sourced in the
environment, OS_USERNAME/OS_PASSWORD/OS_AUTH_URL and also a script
specific variable HEAT_DOMAIN_PASSWORD which specifies the password
for the domain-admin user.  Other values may be overridden by the
environment but default to sane values.

Change-Id: I5731ba72491dcf515c5d230b55056d9263341c54
Partial-Bug: #1287980
"}]
commit_message:
Add tools/create_heat_domain helper script

For users who don't yet have python-openstackclient, or who require
a more automated way of creating the heat domain and domain-admin
user, provide a simple wrapper for the keystoneclient python API
which will create the domain and user, then print a helpful cut/paste
message to allow heat.conf to be easily updated.

It requires a cloud-admin users credentials to be sourced in the
environment, OS_USERNAME/OS_PASSWORD/OS_AUTH_URL and also a script
specific variable HEAT_DOMAIN_PASSWORD which specifies the password
for the domain-admin user.  Other values may be overridden by the
environment but default to sane values.

Change-Id: I5731ba72491dcf515c5d230b55056d9263341c54
Partial-Bug: #1287980

Migrate pre-validation HOT templates to proper schema

Patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/69655 added stricter validation

stacks that may have been created prior to the validation using
non-conforming or proposed syntax.

subject: Modify python-dateutil RPM build process
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-05 16:25:16.000000000', 'files': ['rpmbuild/package_dependencies.sh'], 'message': "Modify python-dateutil RPM build process

The current build process for the python-dateutil RPM generates a
package that when installed lays a number of files on a filesystem
that only root can read.  This is problematic for non-root owned
processes that are trying to read these files.  Adding this patch
opens up those files to reading by process that aren't running as
root.  For example, this would allow for the running of the
reference uWSGI based implementation as a non-root user.

Fixes: bug #1288033
Change-Id: I3bff45bab272de888992cb42a8b8709a3fcd8ec6
"}]
commit_message:
Modify python-dateutil RPM build process

The current build process for the python-dateutil RPM generates a
package that when installed lays a number of files on a filesystem
that only root can read.  This is problematic for non-root owned
processes that are trying to read these files.  Adding this patch
opens up those files to reading by process that aren't running as
root.  For example, this would allow for the running of the
reference uWSGI based implementation as a non-root user.

Fixes: bug #1288033
Change-Id: I3bff45bab272de888992cb42a8b8709a3fcd8ec6

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-04 22:33:13.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'No longer call check_uptodate.sh in pep8

check_uptodate.sh re-generates a nova.conf.sample and then compares

options from oslo, or other modules made releases and then the gate

commit_message:
No longer call check_uptodate.sh in pep8

check_uptodate.sh re-generates a nova.conf.sample and then compares
it, which was fine. It stopped being fine when we started pulling in
options from oslo, or other modules made releases and then the gate
broke until we fixed the config sample.

Change-Id: I04b2b52a9e46dcf5f4f06e639327f22b827ccd0d

CONF_CARTRIDGES env variable support a comma-separated list or a class

Change-Id: I6ae0d29bc397b51a5b7353b8b51bf5d2b1fcba7b
'}]
commit_message:
Support specifying which cartridges are installed on node

The openshift.sh script supports specifying cartridges installed. The
CONF_CARTRIDGES env variable support a comma-separated list or a class
of cartriges "all" or "standard." A prepended minus sign '-' in a list
of carts will negate the list.

Change-Id: I6ae0d29bc397b51a5b7353b8b51bf5d2b1fcba7b

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-03-04 19:34:11.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/utils.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Generic Multiplexed method

Drivers with VendorInterface, provide different vendor_passthru methods.
MultipleVendorInterface allows to mixin the different drivers. If different
drivers provide the same method, the first specified driver is the one
providing it. This can be overrided using extra_mappings.

* Allows multiple vendors
driver.vendor = utils.MixedVendorInterface(pxe, ipminative, seamicro)

* Allows override methods via extra_mappings
extra_mapping = {'set_boot_device': pxe,
                 'continue_deploy': ipminative,
                 'set_vlan': ipmi_tool}
driver.vendor = utils.MixedVendorInterface(pxe, ipminative, extra_mappings=extra_mappings)

* Or indicate the methods to use just using extra_mappings
extra_mapping = {'set_boot_device': pxe,
                 'continue_deploy': ipminative,
                 'set_vlan': ipmi_tool}
driver.vendor = utils.MixedVendorInterface(extra_mappings=extra_mappings)

Partial-Bug: #1264596
Change-Id: Id93db7eb802f2414b4685b298062608a4f4be600
"}]
commit_message:
Generic Multiplexed method

Drivers with VendorInterface, provide different vendor_passthru methods.
MultipleVendorInterface allows to mixin the different drivers. If different
drivers provide the same method, the first specified driver is the one
providing it. This can be overrided using extra_mappings.

* Allows multiple vendors
driver.vendor = utils.MixedVendorInterface(pxe, ipminative, seamicro)

* Allows override methods via extra_mappings
extra_mapping = {'set_boot_device': pxe,
                 'continue_deploy': ipminative,
                 'set_vlan': ipmi_tool}
driver.vendor = utils.MixedVendorInterface(pxe, ipminative, extra_mappings=extra_mappings)

* Or indicate the methods to use just using extra_mappings
extra_mapping = {'set_boot_device': pxe,
                 'continue_deploy': ipminative,
                 'set_vlan': ipmi_tool}
driver.vendor = utils.MixedVendorInterface(extra_mappings=extra_mappings)

Partial-Bug: #1264596
Change-Id: Id93db7eb802f2414b4685b298062608a4f4be600

revisions:

commit_message:
Update 3PAR block storage docs

Document the new QoS settings for the HP 3PAR client.
They are now using the qos_specs instead on putting
them in the extra_specs. Also, qos_specs do not require
the scoping of the keys like the extra_specs did.

Added two new personas along with a few minor edit.

Change-Id: Ibbbf430dd19744e7c45e6e7e4f8374bb61606535
Closes-Bug: #1283181

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-03-05 09:20:58.000000000', 'files': ['marconi/tests/queues/transport/wsgi/test_shards.py', 'marconi/queues/storage/mongodb/queues.py', 'marconi/queues/storage/mongodb/claims.py', 'tests/unit/queues/storage/test_impl_mongodb.py', 'marconi/queues/storage/mongodb/options.py', 'marconi/queues/storage/mongodb/messages.py', 'marconi/queues/storage/mongodb/utils.py', 'tests/etc/wsgi_mongodb.conf'], 'message': 'fix(MongoDB): Driver does not retry on AutoReconnect errors

When a primary MongoDB node fails over to a secondary, pymongo raises an
AutoReconnect error. Let's catch that and retry the operation so that
we truly are Highly Available (in the sense that the user will never notice
the few ms of "downtime" caused by a failover).

This is particularly important when hosting backend with a DBaaS that
routinely fails over the master as a way of compacting shards.

NOTE: In order to get all MongoDB tests green, a tiny unrelated bug in
test_shards was fixed as part of this patch.

Closes-Bug: 1214973
Change-Id: Ibf172e30ec6e7fa0bbb8fdcebda9e985d1e49714
'}]
commit_message:
fix(MongoDB): Driver does not retry on AutoReconnect errors

When a primary MongoDB node fails over to a secondary, pymongo raises an
AutoReconnect error. Let's catch that and retry the operation so that
we truly are Highly Available (in the sense that the user will never notice
the few ms of "downtime" caused by a failover).

This is particularly important when hosting backend with a DBaaS that
routinely fails over the master as a way of compacting shards.

NOTE: In order to get all MongoDB tests green, a tiny unrelated bug in
test_shards was fixed as part of this patch.

Closes-Bug: 1214973
Change-Id: Ibf172e30ec6e7fa0bbb8fdcebda9e985d1e49714

subject: GlusterFS: Set permissions on qcow2 snapshot files
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-28 22:35:55.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/glusterfs.py'], 'message': "GlusterFS: Set permissions on qcow2 snapshot files

The GlusterFS driver sets specific permissions on the
volume file when volumes are created.  Setting them on the
snapshot files at snapshot creation time is also required,
otherwise volume attaches will fail for volumes with snapshots
when using QEMU's libgfapi functionality.

This does not weaken the current security model in any
significant way, as it only lines up the permissions used
for snapshot files with those already used for volume files.

This will eventually be addressed by functionality in libvirt:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1052014

Closes-Bug: #1286376

Change-Id: I93944724c557c907eb3821a061e7434f09ff20bc
"}]
commit_message:
GlusterFS: Set permissions on qcow2 snapshot files

The GlusterFS driver sets specific permissions on the
volume file when volumes are created.  Setting them on the
snapshot files at snapshot creation time is also required,
otherwise volume attaches will fail for volumes with snapshots
when using QEMU's libgfapi functionality.

This does not weaken the current security model in any
significant way, as it only lines up the permissions used
for snapshot files with those already used for volume files.

This will eventually be addressed by functionality in libvirt:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1052014

Closes-Bug: #1286376

Change-Id: I93944724c557c907eb3821a061e7434f09ff20bc

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2014-03-04 22:12:42.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/server.py', 'heat/tests/test_server.py'], 'message': 'Nova server to ref cloud-config resources in user_data

With this change it is now possible to do boot-time cloud-init configuration
using some combination of OS::Heat::MultipartMime, OS::Heat::CloudConfig or
OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig.

Cloud-init configuration is specified by referencing the resource
in the user_data when user_data_format=RAW:

  server:
    type: OS::Nova::Server
    properties:
      ...
      user_data_format: RAW
      user_data:
        get_resource: server_init

Alternatively, the config can be fetched as a string attribute
from the OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig config attribute:

  server:
    type: OS::Nova::Server
    properties:
      ...
      user_data_format: RAW
      user_data:
        get_attr: [server_init, config]

implements blueprint cloud-init-resource
Change-Id: I72f74d302afd71dac3845282dcc9a1ca83e92149
'}]
commit_message:
Nova server to ref cloud-config resources in user_data

With this change it is now possible to do boot-time cloud-init configuration
using some combination of OS::Heat::MultipartMime, OS::Heat::CloudConfig or
OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig.

Cloud-init configuration is specified by referencing the resource
in the user_data when user_data_format=RAW:

  server:
    type: OS::Nova::Server
    properties:
      ...
      user_data_format: RAW
      user_data:
        get_resource: server_init

Alternatively, the config can be fetched as a string attribute
from the OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig config attribute:

  server:
    type: OS::Nova::Server
    properties:
      ...
      user_data_format: RAW
      user_data:
        get_attr: [server_init, config]

implements blueprint cloud-init-resource
Change-Id: I72f74d302afd71dac3845282dcc9a1ca83e92149

commit_message:
Set primary controller role before priorities assignment

If nodes were passed as unsorted list
then there was a problem with wrong priorities
assignment, we have to assign primary-controller
role and only after that set priorities.

Change-Id: I35b824d316261ad555aa555ed5e34afb5857dc8d
Closes-bug: #1287656

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-21 00:17:25.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/v3/test_live_block_migration.py'], 'message': "Allow LiveBlockMigrationV3Test to be skipped if v3 is disabled

The tearDown for LiveBlockMigrationV3Test fails as
self.created_server_ids is initialized after calling
the parent's setUpClass (which in the case of a disabled v3 test,
triggers the tearDown)

Change-Id: Id02e0458883db8b4e64f747b7cc0969684448b9e
Closes-Bug: 1282827
"}]
commit_message:
Allow LiveBlockMigrationV3Test to be skipped if v3 is disabled

The tearDown for LiveBlockMigrationV3Test fails as
self.created_server_ids is initialized after calling
the parent's setUpClass (which in the case of a disabled v3 test,
triggers the tearDown)

Change-Id: Id02e0458883db8b4e64f747b7cc0969684448b9e
Closes-Bug: 1282827

subject: Only execute tearDown if setUpClass created cls.volume
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-21 00:52:47.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/v3/servers/test_server_rescue.py'], 'message': 'Only execute tearDown if setUpClass created cls.volume

If the v3 api is skipped, the setUpClass will not create
cls.volume. The tearDown method must then check if cls.volume
exists before referencing it.

Change-Id: Ie187781cb9ab0371fed49c423c55b694a3c397c4
Closes-Bug: 1282829
'}]
commit_message:
Only execute tearDown if setUpClass created cls.volume

If the v3 api is skipped, the setUpClass will not create
cls.volume. The tearDown method must then check if cls.volume
exists before referencing it.

Change-Id: Ie187781cb9ab0371fed49c423c55b694a3c397c4
Closes-Bug: 1282829

subject: Skip deleting flavors in tearDown if setUpClass did not complete
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-21 01:23:19.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/v3/admin/test_flavors_extra_specs.py', 'tempest/api/compute/v3/admin/test_flavors_extra_specs_negative.py'], 'message': 'Skip deleting flavors in tearDown if setUpClass did not complete

The setUpClass method will not configure cls.client if the v3 api is
disabled per configuration. We must check if cls.client exists before
accessing it in tearDown.

This applies to FlavorExtraSpecs and its negative tests.

Change-Id: I885dad27b6be98c3a3ba52178c19983c4d461fa4
Closes-Bug: #1282839
'}]
commit_message:
Skip deleting flavors in tearDown if setUpClass did not complete

The setUpClass method will not configure cls.client if the v3 api is
disabled per configuration. We must check if cls.client exists before
accessing it in tearDown.

This applies to FlavorExtraSpecs and its negative tests.

Change-Id: I885dad27b6be98c3a3ba52178c19983c4d461fa4
Closes-Bug: #1282839

commit_message:
Added several pacakges to global requirements

OpenStack Murano project components are require the following
packages, which are not presented in global requirements yet:

 jsonpath
 deep
 bunch

This commit adds these requirements to the list of global requirements.

commit_message:
Check self links for consumer get and list tests

Add asserts to check if the self link is correct for the get and
list tests for consumer.

Also created a class variable for '/OS-OAUTH1/consumers' instead
of having it hard coded in a bunch of spots.

Partially fixes Bug: #1279492

Change-Id: Ib9259e65b37507ee49416d7ac8c738fbfd1d329c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-04 22:34:03.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Stop gating on up-to-date sample config file.

The sample config file could get out of date if any of the oslo
libraries changed under us, which would cause everything to fail.
Rather than get blocked by library changes, this check will not be
done anymore.

Change-Id: I96ac66ca9d01a08274c00c98f37453e299ef5423
'}]
commit_message:
Stop gating on up-to-date sample config file.

The sample config file could get out of date if any of the oslo
libraries changed under us, which would cause everything to fail.
Rather than get blocked by library changes, this check will not be
done anymore.

Change-Id: I96ac66ca9d01a08274c00c98f37453e299ef5423

subject: Fix regex for file size to parse float-style numbers properly
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-27 18:48:55.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/imageutils.py', 'tests/unit/test_imageutils.py'], 'message': "Fix regex for file size to parse float-style numbers properly

The SIZE_RE regex was not accounting for the fact that the size of the
file can be reported as a float style number (eg '2.0G') and so the size
of the file was not being reported in bytes correctly.

Change-Id: I9c820be287da32f3853bf9af5606cbbaf714e843
Closes-Bug: #1285764
"}]
commit_message:
Fix regex for file size to parse float-style numbers properly

The SIZE_RE regex was not accounting for the fact that the size of the
file can be reported as a float style number (eg '2.0G') and so the size
of the file was not being reported in bytes correctly.

Change-Id: I9c820be287da32f3853bf9af5606cbbaf714e843
Closes-Bug: #1285764

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-28 19:49:36.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.d3piechart.js'], 'message': 'Fix animation on pie charts

Animation on pie charts in Project > Overview and Admin > Hypervisros
does not start at 0 degree which, depending on the percentage used
for a resource, could cause the pie chart animate counter-clockwise.
This patch fixes the issue by setting the start angle to 0 degree.

The patch also fixes the issue with the last pie chart where it does
not animate.

Closes-Bug: #1283306
Change-Id: Ibc7f676f522a7e3ea69f87f36898249ecd0fe326
'}]
commit_message:
Fix animation on pie charts

Animation on pie charts in Project > Overview and Admin > Hypervisros
does not start at 0 degree which, depending on the percentage used
for a resource, could cause the pie chart animate counter-clockwise.
This patch fixes the issue by setting the start angle to 0 degree.

The patch also fixes the issue with the last pie chart where it does
not animate.

Closes-Bug: #1283306
Change-Id: Ibc7f676f522a7e3ea69f87f36898249ecd0fe326

This commit removes the use of str() from LOG.* messages
and exceptions.

The reason we need to remove str() is because str() will fail if
it gets a Unicode string that has something that doesn't translate
to ASCII in it.  If such a situation is encountered you will lose
the message string in question.  In most cases, the use of str() is
unnecessary for LOG.* and exception messages.  Using %s is smart
enough to figure out what to do with what it is passed.  It first
tries to str() it, if this fails it falls back to using unicode.  Either
way, the result will then be something that gettextutils can
handle and translate.

Change-Id: I6eb81043edd9fa5e035d81ee81e8439340546d24
Closes-bug: 1274245
Related-bp: i18n-messages
"}]
commit_message:
Remove str() from LOG.* and exceptions

This commit removes the use of str() from LOG.* messages
and exceptions.

The reason we need to remove str() is because str() will fail if
it gets a Unicode string that has something that doesn't translate
to ASCII in it.  If such a situation is encountered you will lose
the message string in question.  In most cases, the use of str() is
unnecessary for LOG.* and exception messages.  Using %s is smart
enough to figure out what to do with what it is passed.  It first
tries to str() it, if this fails it falls back to using unicode.  Either
way, the result will then be something that gettextutils can
handle and translate.

Change-Id: I6eb81043edd9fa5e035d81ee81e8439340546d24
Closes-bug: 1274245
Related-bp: i18n-messages

commit_message:
Quota delete operation in cinder

This change adds the quota-delete operation to cinder.

It is adding the api and the tests, using the methods already
implemented in the db to destroy all the quotas for a specific
project.

Implements blueprint quota-delete

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia040a20abb831c311eb13624ddecbbf0f12fdd9f

subject: Allow Messages in NotImplementedErrors
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-05 05:01:52.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/base.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_mongodb.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_hbase.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_db2.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py', 'ceilometer/storage/pymongo_base.py'], 'message': "Allow Messages in NotImplementedErrors

If print'd or str()'d a regular NotImplementedError that was created
with a translatable Message will raise an exception because it will try
to str() the underlying Message, which is already a text type, but
str()'ing a Message is not allowed.

This patch overrides the default behavior in a new class called
LocalizableNotImplementedError to remove that problem. Without this, if
a NotImplementedError reaches WSME it would break because exceptions in
WSME are str()'d.

Change-Id: Ieb306511a2237bea7e5b5a2daf7fc996317d1571
Partial-Bug: #1275901
"}]
commit_message:
Allow Messages in NotImplementedErrors

If print'd or str()'d a regular NotImplementedError that was created
with a translatable Message will raise an exception because it will try
to str() the underlying Message, which is already a text type, but
str()'ing a Message is not allowed.

This patch overrides the default behavior in a new class called
LocalizableNotImplementedError to remove that problem. Without this, if
a NotImplementedError reaches WSME it would break because exceptions in
WSME are str()'d.

Change-Id: Ieb306511a2237bea7e5b5a2daf7fc996317d1571
Partial-Bug: #1275901

commit_message:
Add support for libvirt secret management

This change adds support for libvirt secret management to the libvirt
driver, providing create, delete, and existence methods for libvirt
secrets. Support for creating and parsing libvirt secret XML is
included, along with a designer method for instantiating a libvirt
secret with standard options. Additional test cases and a new libvirt
driver test suite are also included.

This patch is the first in a series that will add support for qcow2
ephemeral storage encryption. For more information, see the blueprint
linked below:

blueprint encrypt-ephemeral-storage

Change-Id: I074753679b7994ece123abc282497b2ee860f3bc

subject: Add the OVA container format
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-04 03:50:50.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/config.py', 'etc/glance-api.conf', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_images_resource.py', 'doc/source/formats.rst'], 'message': 'Add the OVA container format

An OVA package is a tar archive usually containing an OVF directory
inside it. Nova needs to be able to differentiate OVF and OVA based on
the container format in order to extract the relevant information from
it.
This patch adds the OVA container format to the Glance configuration.

Closes-Bug: #1286375

Change-Id: I5034d2943907823a9296e7a5fb41a28f2d92ec5a
'}]
commit_message:
Add the OVA container format

An OVA package is a tar archive usually containing an OVF directory
inside it. Nova needs to be able to differentiate OVF and OVA based on
the container format in order to extract the relevant information from
it.
This patch adds the OVA container format to the Glance configuration.

Closes-Bug: #1286375

Change-Id: I5034d2943907823a9296e7a5fb41a28f2d92ec5a

commit_message:
NEC plugin: PFC packet fitler support

It also enhances the following points of packet filter code:
- Allow to clear filter fields to wildcard by specifying None
  in PUT method
- Return None for wildcard fields in an API response
- Determine eth_type based on protocol field on DB layer
- Support OFC driver-specific API validation and update support
- Refactor packet filter code and better validations

Implements blueprint nec-packet-filter-pfc
Change-Id: I2b208c66a9f119ef6d2ef78079d9a7e5965202e7

commit_message:
fix tgt to use 'service' instead of upstart calls

the comments in here were largely about oneric, which we don't
support any more. service is installed in a precise environment,
and will support debian and the upcoming transition to systemd
better, so use that instead.

Change-Id: If15493549a8c93a7387df9b3bba31443aed46995

subject: Split out config option registration
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-28 21:43:10.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/generate_sample_tempest.py', 'tempest/config.py'], 'message': 'Split out config option registration

This commit takes the option registration and local attr settings from
the tempest private config object and splits them out as separate
functions. This exposes a way to register the config options without
creating a config object. This enables the config options and defaults
to be more easily used for unit tests and external utilities, such as
the sample generator.

Change-Id: I2ed7e33a14e652f0ec9be2cce069b4925c02b3bd
'}]
commit_message:
Split out config option registration

This commit takes the option registration and local attr settings from
the tempest private config object and splits them out as separate
functions. This exposes a way to register the config options without
creating a config object. This enables the config options and defaults
to be more easily used for unit tests and external utilities, such as
the sample generator.

Change-Id: I2ed7e33a14e652f0ec9be2cce069b4925c02b3bd

commit_message:
Prepare for enabling H302 rule(services/compute/json)

Currently H302 rule is ignored by tox. However, this rule should
be enabled. This patch partially fixes this problem to prepare for
H302 rule.

Change-Id: I93204fb215b54b8a304224b249320428870dedde

subject: Check if snapshot is deleted cleanly.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-02 14:12:34.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_smis_common.py'], 'message': 'Check if snapshot is deleted cleanly.

This patch added a check in delete_snapshot to make sure the
snapshot is deleted cleanly.  Without this check, if someone
tries to delete the source volume immediately after the snapshot
deletion, it will fail with error that the volume still has
snapshot.

Closes-Bug: #1286699

Change-Id: Idf4508025b403fa572584e5204b3891375fed6c6
'}]
commit_message:
Check if snapshot is deleted cleanly.

This patch added a check in delete_snapshot to make sure the
snapshot is deleted cleanly.  Without this check, if someone
tries to delete the source volume immediately after the snapshot
deletion, it will fail with error that the volume still has
snapshot.

Closes-Bug: #1286699

Change-Id: Idf4508025b403fa572584e5204b3891375fed6c6

novaclient raises an OverLimit exception when a 413 response code (API
limit) is returned from the Nova API.  Previously, this would cause the

Implements: blueprint improve-api-polling

commit_message:
Handle API limit exception in nova_utils.refresh_server

novaclient raises an OverLimit exception when a 413 response code (API
limit) is returned from the Nova API.  Previously, this would cause the
stack action to fail.  Log a warning instead.

Change-Id: I52c9dc96b34d0645662d98aaeebb7dabe6956e25
Implements: blueprint improve-api-polling

commit_message:
Adds support for Nova RDP console

Hyper-V employs RDP to access virtual machine consoles, unlike most
other hypervisors which support VNC.

In order to support this scenario, the get_rdp_console API has been
added to Nova. This commit adds the corresponding UI feature,
implemented in a way consistent with existing VNC and SPICE console
support.

Change-Id: I9722a1aef5d26184f5a6bc278e306acbdae76b7b
Blueprint: hyper-v-rdp-console

commit_message:
Add GlanceLogFile and GlanceNotifierStrategy

Expose 2 new parameters to control glance configuration:
- GlanceLogFile
- GlanceNotifierStrategy

This will allow the glance configuration options log_file and
notifier_strategy to be set in glance-api.conf and glance-registry.conf

Change-Id: I1af1ecfdfe0859f2baba4579aab6e947a2a54308

Images now support multiple locations within its metadata and it may be
stored on more than one backend storage. Nova should add a layer to
transparently handle image preparing and removing for an instance by the
best approach/location, and it should allow administrators to configure
the image handler pipeline with the order who preferred to the layer.

Also, based on this structure we could implement particular sub-class in
relevant hypervisor layer with more advanced functions, such as CoW
making, snapshot capturing and etc. in future.

Implement bp: image-multiple-location
DocImpact

Change-Id: Idce8d21ae37bfdbb28a2567120a83d1061061904
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Adding image multiple location support

Images now support multiple locations within its metadata and it may be
stored on more than one backend storage. Nova should add a layer to
transparently handle image preparing and removing for an instance by the
best approach/location, and it should allow administrators to configure
the image handler pipeline with the order who preferred to the layer.

Also, based on this structure we could implement particular sub-class in
relevant hypervisor layer with more advanced functions, such as CoW
making, snapshot capturing and etc. in future.

Implement bp: image-multiple-location
DocImpact

Change-Id: Idce8d21ae37bfdbb28a2567120a83d1061061904
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
NetApp eseries iscsi driver implementation

This change introduces the iscsi
driver for NetApp eseries family of storage
systems. E-series is another  storage
solution offered by NetApp.

Related-Bug: 1278567
Implements: blueprint netapp-eseries--cinder-driver
Certification results: https://launchpadlibrarian.net/166301064/eseries_cinder_certification.log

Change-Id: I8b55d1f1c8de12052281c7cae0c2f89a9d2c3dd1

subject: Parameterize disk_cachemodes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-04 08:23:56.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/nova_compute_libvirt_spec.rb', 'manifests/compute/libvirt.pp'], 'message': "Parameterize disk_cachemodes

The current manifests don't expose a way for end users to set
the disk_cachemodes directive in nova.conf, which can be useful
for improving disk performance.  This patch adds a parameter
allowing users to specify a list of values to be written in
to the disk_cachemodes setting.  The default value is an empty
list, which will cause the disk_cachemodes setting to be removed
entirely from nova.conf (thus matching the Nova default and
current behavior).

This patch is based on 0a5d6568f070d193b604513f194c966cc224a86b
but is slightly modified to account for a change in how the
nova.conf file is organized between Havana and Icehouse
(some libvirt params were moved from the [DEFAULT] section
to the new [libvirt] section in Icehouse).

Change-Id: I9173ef79e4e573515f290734535907794dda7dbf
(cherry picked from commit 0a5d6568f070d193b604513f194c966cc224a86b)
"}]
commit_message:
Parameterize disk_cachemodes

The current manifests don't expose a way for end users to set
the disk_cachemodes directive in nova.conf, which can be useful
for improving disk performance.  This patch adds a parameter
allowing users to specify a list of values to be written in
to the disk_cachemodes setting.  The default value is an empty
list, which will cause the disk_cachemodes setting to be removed
entirely from nova.conf (thus matching the Nova default and
current behavior).

This patch is based on 0a5d6568f070d193b604513f194c966cc224a86b
but is slightly modified to account for a change in how the
nova.conf file is organized between Havana and Icehouse
(some libvirt params were moved from the [DEFAULT] section
to the new [libvirt] section in Icehouse).

Change-Id: I9173ef79e4e573515f290734535907794dda7dbf
(cherry picked from commit 0a5d6568f070d193b604513f194c966cc224a86b)

commit_message:
Sanitize file paths

Some absolute paths are computed at runtime and give result that are not
suitable for publishing. This patch sanitize such paths.

Change-Id: I0b4569de50ce6d75f87f2976654d7534bb91df2a
